results.title: Taijiquan (Tai Chi): the 24 forms
results.creator_credit: East Acton Videos and Michael Ngai
results.brief_description: Tai Chi is a simple and powerfully effective art form, proven by clinical studies to help relax and yet strengthen both body and mind. Being the most popular Forms in the world today, the 24 Forms is considered to be perfectly suitable for students of almost any level of physical fitness and age. Features step by step teaching with precise and easy to follow instructions suitable for all levels of learning, 6 Qigong excerises, 7 single movements and demonstrations by medal winning instructors from Health Tai Chi Chuan.

results.title: Tai Chi (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The ancient art of Tai Chi has been practised for hundreds of years and is a valuable form of self expression which helps the mind and body to relax. Tai Chi has become increasingly popular in the often stressful framework of twentieth century living. It aims to develop a strong co-ordinated body which is able to function in a relaxed, calm manner at all times. This video methodically guides us through each graceful movement, clearly emphasising the careful attention which must be given to posture. Master Erle Montaigue, one of the foremost authorities on the original Yang style of Tai Chi, demonstrates and discusses the movements with the viewer and reaffirms its healing powers which contribute to that special sense of well-being.

results.title: Tai-pan = Tai pan
results.creator_credit: De Laurentiis Entertainment Group, Raffaella De Laurentiis and Daryl Duke
results.brief_description: Tai-Pan is an epic adventure-romance set against the backdrop of the founding of Hong Kong as a British colony, circa 1842, in response to the opium wars between Britain and China. The plot revolves around an unscrupulous merchant trader Dirk Struan (Bryan Brown), and his long-standing feud with a rival merchant as each battles for supremacy as the ruling British merchant, or Tai-Pan, of Hong Kong. Over the years their bitter rivalry between the two men becomes murderous resulting eventually in a momentous showdown. Based on James Clavell’s ambitious novel of the same name (the first of his Noble House series), the film simplifies the book’s intricate sub-plots, only partially succeeding in capturing the spirit, depth and complexity of its source. Cast also includes Joan Chen, John Stanton and Bill Leadbitter.

results.title: Tahrir Square during the Arab Spring uprising
results.credit_line: Courtesy Los Angeles Times. Copyright 2012, Los Angeles Times
results.brief_description: In 2011, the connectivity and speed of social media seemed promising for society and democracy. Platforms like Facebook, Twitter and YouTube were integral to mobilising people and coordinating protest movements like the Arab Spring, a series of anti-government protests, uprisings and revolutions.

results.title: Tahere Tikitiki: the making of a Maori canoe
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit and David H. Fowler
results.brief_description: Follows the building of a Maori canoe, picturing the lives of the men who make the canoe while relating the symbolic elements of Maori culture which enter into the activity.

results.title: Tag
results.brief_description: This proposed public imaging project shows a middle-aged woman standing in the middle of a well-furnished lounge room, wearing only her underwear and a blindfold. Other middle-aged people stand around her, also in their underwear, as she tries to find them while blindfolded. Bumping into things, tripping over furniture and laughing in the process- we follow the game from room to room as the woman in the blindfold tries to catch the various people taunting her. Finally tagging a younger man in the kitchen, the woman rips off the blindfold to see who she has caught. The image then cuts to static briefly and we start the game again, only this time with the man that was found or “tagged” now wearing the blindfold. This process repeats a number of times until most people at the party have been blindfolded. Stylistically, the video material will be a mixture of handheld home video cinematography juxtaposed with locked-off tripod material shot with multiple video cameras. The video imagery will then be degraded and transferred to 16mm- the final, highly textured imagery resembling a badly tuned television broadcast of surveillance camera footage.

results.title: Taffy's imagination: fear of the dark
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forest town fables”.
One of a series of six Forest Town Fables, this film presents realistic explanations of imagined fantasies, so that darkness can be faced with confidence. It explains that Taffy is afraid of the dark until her puppet friends teach her their night game. It also shows how she discovers that things she saw and heard were imagined. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
